question: [File: aptos-core/ecosystem/node-checker/fn-check-client/src/get_vfns.rs] [Function: get_validator_infos()] [Remote Data Integrity] Can a malicious or compromised node at node_address return crafted ValidatorSet data that causes deserialization panics or undefined behavior when processed by get_account_resource_bcs()? (High)

[File: aptos-core/ecosystem/node-checker/fn-check-client/src/get_vfns.rs] [Function: get_validator_infos()] [Resource Exhaustion] Can an attacker control the node_address endpoint to return an extremely large ValidatorSet (millions of validators) causing memory exhaustion or OOM when loading active_validators into memory? (Medium)

[File: aptos-core/ecosystem/node-checker/fn-check-client/src/get_vfns.rs] [Function: get_validator_infos()] [Array Access] Does the unwrap() on first() and last() at lines 46-47 create a panic vulnerability if active_validators is empty, allowing a malicious node to crash the checker by returning an empty validator set? (Medium)

[File: aptos-core/ecosystem/node-checker/fn-check-client/src/get_vfns.rs] [Function: get_validator_infos()] [Type Confusion] Can the BCS deserialization of ValidatorSet be exploited with malformed binary data to cause type confusion, reading incorrect struct fields or bypassing validation logic? (High)

[File: aptos-core/ecosystem/node-checker/fn-check-client/src/get_vfns.rs] [Function: get_validator_infos()] [Hardcoded Address] Is the CORE_CODE_ADDRESS (0x1) and resource path '0x1::stake::ValidatorSet' validated to match the actual network being queried, or can a malicious node return data from a different module causing logic errors? (Medium)

[File: aptos-core/ecosystem/node-checker/fn-check-client/src/get_vfns.rs] [Function: get_validator_infos()] [Race Condition] If get_validator_infos() is called concurrently from multiple threads, can the REST client connection pool be exhausted or cause race conditions in the underlying AptosClient? (Low)

[File: aptos-core/ecosystem/node-checker/fn-check-client/src/get_vfns.rs] [Function: get_validator_infos()] [Network Partition] Can an attacker perform a network partition attack by controlling node_address to return stale or forked ValidatorSet data, causing the node checker to validate against outdated validator info? (High)

[File: aptos-core/ecosystem/node-checker/fn-check-client/src/get_vfns.rs] [Function: get_validator_infos()] [Integer Overflow] Can the len() calculation on active_validators overflow if the validator set contains more than usize::MAX validators, causing incorrect log output or array access errors? (Low)

[File: aptos-core/ecosystem/node-checker/fn-check-client/src/get_vfns.rs] [Function: get_node_infos()] [Allowlist Bypass] Can an attacker manipulate AccountAddress string representation to bypass the account_address_allowlist check at lines 79-83, such as using different hex encodings (0x vs no prefix, uppercase vs lowercase)? (High)

[File: aptos-core/ecosystem/node-checker/fn-check-client/src/get_vfns.rs] [Function: get_node_infos()] [Time-of-Check-Time-of-Use] Between checking the allowlist and processing validator_info, can the validator_info data be modified through a race condition, allowing unauthorized validators to be processed? (Medium)

[File: aptos-core/ecosystem/node-checker/fn-check-client/src/get_vfns.rs] [Function: get_node_infos()] [Error Swallowing] When fullnode_network_addresses() fails at line 85-100, the error is logged but processing continues - can this allow validators with intentionally malformed addresses to avoid detection and remain in the validator set? (Medium)

[File: aptos-core/ecosystem/node-checker/fn-check-client/src/get_vfns.rs] [Function: get_node_infos()] [HashMap Collision] Can an attacker craft multiple ValidatorInfo entries with the same account_address causing HashMap collisions at lines 88-90 and 104-106, potentially overwriting legitimate validator data? (High)

[File: aptos-core/ecosystem/node-checker/fn-check-client/src/get_vfns.rs] [Function: get_node_infos()] [Resource Exhaustion] Can a malicious validator register thousands of VFN addresses causing the vfn_addresses vector to grow unbounded, exhausting memory when processing the loop at lines 114-141? (Medium)

[File: aptos-core/ecosystem/node-checker/fn-check-client/src/get_vfns.rs] [Function: get_node_infos()] [Mutable Iterator] The validator_infos.iter_mut() at line 77 allows mutation - can this lead to use-after-free or data corruption if validator_info is modified during iteration in concurrent scenarios? (High)

[File: aptos-core/ecosystem/node-checker/fn-check-client/src/get_vfns.rs] [Function: get_node_infos()] [Empty Allowlist Semantics] When account_address_allowlist is empty, all validators are processed - is this the intended behavior, or should an empty allowlist mean 'allow none' to prevent accidental exposure? (Medium)

[File: aptos-core/ecosystem/node-checker/fn-check-client/src/get_vfns.rs] [Function: get_node_infos()] [Duplicate Detection] Can a validator register the same VFN address multiple times, causing duplicate NodeInfo entries in the node_infos HashMap at lines 132-140, leading to redundant checks or state confusion? (Medium)

[File: aptos-core/ecosystem/node-checker/fn-check-client/src/get_vfns.rs] [Function: get_node_infos()] [Address Injection] Can the extract_network_address() function at line 115 be exploited with crafted NetworkAddress strings containing injection attacks (e.g., URL injection, command injection in DNS lookups)? (Critical)

[File: aptos-core/ecosystem/node-checker/fn-check-client/src/get_vfns.rs] [Function: get_node_infos()] [Invalid Port Numbers] Does extract_network_address() validate that noise_port is within valid range (1-65535), or can a validator register port 0 or negative ports causing connection failures or undefined behavior? (Medium)

[File: aptos-core/ecosystem/node-checker/fn-check-client/src/get_vfns.rs] [Function: get_node_infos()] [DNS Rebinding] When extracting node_url from NetworkAddress, can an attacker use DNS rebinding to redirect the checker to internal/private IPs after initial validation, causing SSRF attacks? (High)

[File: aptos-core/ecosystem/node-checker/fn-check-client/src/get_vfns.rs] [Function: get_node_infos()] [IPv6 Handling] Does extract_network_address() properly handle IPv6 addresses with zone identifiers, compressed notation, and embedded IPv4, or can malformed IPv6 strings cause parsing errors or bypasses? (Medium)

[File: aptos-core/ecosystem/node-checker/fn-check-client/src/get_vfns.rs] [Function: get_node_infos()] [Protocol Confusion] If node_url contains unexpected protocols (e.g., file://, data://, javascript:), will the checker handle them safely or can this lead to code execution or local file access? (High)

[File: aptos-core/ecosystem/node-checker/fn-check-client/src/get_vfns.rs] [Function: get_node_infos()] [Noise Key Validation] The public_key is extracted via find_noise_proto() at line 139 - is this cryptographic key validated for format, length, and validity, or can a validator register an invalid key causing downstream crypto failures? (High)

[File: aptos-core/ecosystem/node-checker/fn-check-client/src/get_vfns.rs] [Function: get_node_infos()] [Empty Network Address] When vfn_addresses is empty at line 103, a NoVfnRegistered error is recorded - but can a validator bypass this by registering a single invalid address that fails extraction, avoiding the empty check? (Medium)

[File: aptos-core/ecosystem/node-checker/fn-check-client/src/get_vfns.rs] [Function: get_node_infos()] [URL Normalization] Are node_urls normalized to prevent duplicates (e.g., example.com vs example.com. vs example.com:80), or can a validator register multiple entries for the same endpoint? (Low)

[File: aptos-core/ecosystem/node-checker/fn-check-client/src/get_vfns.rs] [Function: get_node_infos()] [Partial Failure Handling] When some VFN addresses succeed and others fail for a single validator, both node_infos and invalid_node_address_results contain entries - does downstream code handle this partial state correctly? (Medium)
